common

Interface IReceiver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LobbyReceiver, Receiver, ServerReceiver

    public interface IReceiver
extends java.rmi.Remote
    IReceiver defines a receiver in a chat room, which corresponds to a user (More accurately, a remote user's chat room) in the remote. Similar to IUser, IReceiver is NOT transmitted to anyone. ONLY the STUB of this Remote object is ever transmitted.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IUser getUserStub()
      Get the user stub corresponding to the IReceiver interface
      java.util.UUID getUUID()
      Get the UUID of this receiver.
      <T extends ICRMessageType>
      void      		 receive(DataPacketCR<T> data)
      Receive a data packet.

    • Method Detail

      • getUUID

        java.util.UUID getUUID()
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Get the UUID of this receiver. The UUID value must equals the UUID value of the user, i.e. all receivers belonging to the same user must have the same UUID value, which equals the UUID value of this user.
        Returns:
        the UUID of this receiver.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a network error occurs.

      • receive

        <T extends ICRMessageType> void receive(DataPacketCR<T> data)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Receive a data packet. If it is an unknown data packet or possible error happens, the receiver asynchronously sends a data packet back to the sender. Note that the data packet type and visitor type are both different from the user level communication.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the data being held.
        Parameters:
        data - the received data packet
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a network error occurs

      • getUserStub

        IUser getUserStub()
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Get the user stub corresponding to the IReceiver interface
        Returns:
        a user stub
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a network error occurs
